passage_text: The Dallas Cowboys in their new $1.15 billion home. I’m in Arlington, Tex., standing outside the NFL’s newest stadium, the state-of-the-art home of the Dallas Cowboys. With its $1.15 billion price tag, Cowboys Stadium represents the best and worst of today’s NFL experience. But in order to enjoy it, fans need to dig deep into their wallets–make that bank accounts. While the average cost of attending an NFL game for a family of four is $412.64, it’s a staggering $758.58 to watch the Cowboys. (That figure includes tickets and drinks for four people, as well as a couple of caps.)
